children.description: Before
When Carlos log in the application as an adminUser
Carlos login with the credentials of an adminUser to /users/sessions
Carlos sends a POST request to '/users/sessions'

children.description: Carlos ensures that the status of the last response does equal 200

Carlos ensures that the body of the last response does match with schema { "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#", "type": "object", "properties": { "user_id": { "type": "integer" }, "token_expires_at": { "type": "string" } }, "required": [ "user_id", "token_expires_at" ] }
Carlos takes note of 'token'
Carlos changes API URL and sets header "Authorization" to "the 'authorization' header of the last response"
Carlos takes note of 'user_id'
Then he should get a token and the user id to use that
Carlos ensures that the 'authorization' header of the last response does not equal ''
Carlos ensures that the body of the last response does have property 'user_id' that does not equal 0
When he requests the purchased books
Then he should see a list with all his purchased books
Before
When Carlos log in the application as an regularUser
Carlos login with the credentials of an regularUser to /users/sessions
Carlos sends a POST request to '/users/sessions'

userStory.narrative:
As a user of Naiofy
I want to log in the application
so I can use that

dataTable.scenarioOutline:
When Carlos log in the application as an <type>
Then he should get a token and the user id to use that
When he requests the purchased books
Then he should see a list with all his purchased books
